name: num::nonzero::NonZero::<u32>::isolate_lowest_one

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

num::<impl u32>::wrapping_neg.doc:
Wrapping (modular) negation. Computes `-self`,
 wrapping around at the boundary of the type.

 Since unsigned types do not have negative equivalents
 all applications of this function will wrap (except for `-0`).
 For values smaller than the corresponding signed type's maximum
 the result is the same as casting the corresponding signed value.
 Any larger values are equivalent to `MAX + 1 - (val - MAX - 1)` where
 `MAX` is the corresponding signed type's maximum.

 # Examples

 ```
 ```

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::new_unchecke.doc:
Creates a non-zero without checking whether the value is non-zero.
 This results in undefined behavior if the value is zero.

 # Safety

 The value must not be zero.
